description: A Devil Fruit that allows the user to create and manipulate gravitational forces. The user can alter the gravity of objects or areas, enabling them to levitate matter, crush opponents with increased gravity, or even pull down meteors from space.

keyMoments.title: Fujitora's Introduction
keyMoments.description: Fujitora makes his first appearance in Dressrosa, though his Devil Fruit powers are not yet displayed in this episode. His identity as a Devil Fruit user remains unrevealed.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of the character who possesses one of the most powerful Devil Fruits, capable of manipulating gravity itself.

weaknesses.weakness: Standard Devil Fruit weakness to seawater and Seastone

description: A Devil Fruit that allows the user to transform living people into toys and erase all memories of their existence from others. It also grants the user eternal youth, stopping their aging at the age they consumed the fruit.

abilities.description: The user can turn any living being into a toy by touching them, erasing all memories of that person's existence from everyone except the transformed individual.
abilities.limitations: If the user loses consciousness or dies, all transformations are immediately reversed.

abilities.description: The user stops aging from the moment they consume the fruit, maintaining their appearance forever.

keyMoments.title: Living Toys Mystery Introduced
keyMoments.description: The Straw Hats witness living toys throughout Dressrosa, not yet knowing they are the result of Sugar's Hobi Hobi no Mi ability. The toys appear sentient, working and living alongside humans.
keyMoments.significance: First visual evidence of the Hobi Hobi no Mi's effects, though the true nature of the toys remains a mystery. This sets up one of the arc's biggest reveals.

weaknesses.weakness: If the user is knocked unconscious or killed, all transformations are instantly reversed and all erased memories return.
Standard Devil Fruit weakness to seawater and Seastone
